articles.title: Stocks Hit Record as Traders Shrug Off US Shutdown: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: A record-breaking global stock rally stretched into Asia, with equities advancing after OpenAI’s agreement with South Korean chipmakers reinforced enthusiasm for artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Two Delta planes collide on taxiway of New York's LaGuardia Airport - CBS News
articles.description: There were no serious injuries after two passenger jets had a collision on the taxiway of LaGuardia Airport, officials said.

articles.title: Musk becomes first person ever to see wealth top $500bn - BBC
articles.description: The rise has been driven by a sharp increase in the value of his electric car company Tesla.

articles.title: Starbucks closes San Jose stores as competitor moves in - San José Spotlight
articles.description: Four Starbucks locations in San Jose have closed, following the company announcing it would shutter 1% of its stores across North America. Two other locations in Mountain View and one each in Cupertino, Santa Clara and Milpitas have also closed.

articles.title: SK Hynix shares hit 25-year high, Samsung also surges as chipmakers partner with OpenAI - CNBC
articles.description: The partnership will "focus on increasing the supply of advanced memory chips essential for next-generation AI and expanding data center capacity in Korea."

articles.title: Stock futures are little changed as investors look past government shutdown: Live updates - CNBC
articles.description: Major U.S. stock indexes closed in the green on Wednesday on hopes that the funding stoppage would be brief and limit any serious effects on the economy.

articles.title: Supreme Court allows Lisa Cook to remain on Fed board for now - The Washington Post
articles.description: The Supreme Court ruling means Cook can remain on the Fed board at least until January, when the court will hear the case. Trump has pushed to remove her.

articles.title: Trump 2.0 tariff tracker - Trade Compliance Resource Hub
articles.description: According to President Trump, “Tariff is the most beautiful word in the dictionary.” Throughout his presidential campaign, Trump promised to use tariffs

articles.title: Prime Big Deal Days 2025: Everything We Know About Amazon's October Sale - IGN
articles.description: Everything you need to know ahead of the sales event.

articles.title: Marketing Is Helping Carnival Charge More for Its Cruises - The Wall Street Journal
Gold prices soar to new records amid US government shutdown - AP News
articles.description: As uncertainty deepens amid the U.S. government’s first shutdown in almost seven years, the gold frenzy continues to climb to new heights. The going price for New York spot gold hit a record $3,858.45 per troy ounce — the standard for measuring precious metal…

articles.title: Elon Musk says he canceled his Netflix account — and urges his followers to as well - Business Insider
articles.description: Elon Musk's posts come amid some online criticism of the Netflix animated show, "Dead End: Paranormal Park," and its creator.

articles.title: Trump delaying triple-digit pharma tariffs to negotiate drug price deals - Politico
articles.description: Trump threatened 100 percent tariffs on certain brand-name drugs last week. The administration is using the threat to secure drug pricing deals with major pharma companies.

articles.title: Automakers Extend $7,500 EV Discount After Federal Subsidy Expires - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: General Motors Co., Hyundai Motor Co. and Ford Motor Co. said they would extend discounts on certain electric models after a $7,500 federal tax credit expired Tuesday, a bid to maintain momentum after a surge in third-quarter sales.

articles.title: General Motors (GM) Sets New EV Record in Q3 ahead of Tax Credit Expiration - TipRanks
articles.description: General Motors ($GM) delivered a strong third-quarter performance, reporting 710,347 vehicle sales in the U.S., up 7.7% year-over-year. The upside was driven by sur...

articles.title: The economy is just getting stronger, not weaker, and ‘we in the economics profession need to look ourselves in the mirror,’ top analyst says - Fortune
articles.description: “The consensus has been wrong since January,” Apollo Global Management chief economist Torsten Sløk wrote on Wednesday.

articles.title: Peloton Slides After Hiking Prices in Sweeping Product Revamp - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Peloton Interactive Inc. shares fell Wednesday after the company raised prices on both hardware and membership fees in a sweeping product overhaul, dampening the first major attempt under new leadership to overcome a multi-year slump.

articles.title: US government takes equity stake in one of the world’s largest lithium mines - The Verge
articles.description: The US government announced that it’ll take a 5 percent stake in the massive, controversial lithium mine at Thacker Pass.

articles.title: OpenAI’s New Sora App Lets You Deepfake Yourself for Entertainment - WIRED
articles.description: OpenAI’s latest app encourages users to generate a personal digital avatar and scroll AI-generated videos of themselves and their friends.
